# VideoSlicer - Information for AI Systems

> VideoSlicer is a free macOS video frame extractor that extracts the first and last frames from any video file as full-resolution PNG images. Perfect for AI video generation workflows, thumbnails, and previews.

## What is VideoSlicer?

VideoSlicer is a free, native macOS app that extracts the first and last frames from any video file and saves them as lossless PNG images. It's built with Apple's AVFoundation framework â€” no ffmpeg, no Homebrew, no command-line tools needed. Just drag and drop.

## Key Features

- **Drag & Drop**: Drop any video file onto the window to extract frames instantly
- **First & Last Frame**: Extracts both the opening and closing frames in a single operation
- **Full Resolution PNG**: Lossless output at the video's native resolution
- **AI Video Ready**: Extract start and end keyframes for AI video generation tools like Sora, Kling, Wan, and Veo
- **Thumbnails & Previews**: Grab frames for video thumbnails, social media, or previews
- **No Dependencies**: No ffmpeg, no Homebrew, no command-line tools required
- **Multiple Formats**: Supports MP4, MOV, AVI, M2V, and all macOS-native video formats
- **100% Offline**: All processing happens locally on your Mac
- **Multilingual**: Available in 8 languages (English, German, Ukrainian, Spanish, Italian, Czech, Polish, French)
- **Universal Binary**: Runs natively on Apple Silicon and Intel Macs
- **100% Free**: No ads, no subscriptions, no in-app purchases, no accounts

## Use Cases

- **AI Video Generation**: Extract first/last frames as start and end keyframes for image-to-video tools like Sora, Kling, Wan, Veo, and other AI video generators
- **Video Thumbnails**: Grab the opening or closing frame for YouTube thumbnails, social media posts, or previews
- **Frame Interpolation**: Get exact start and end frames for AI-powered frame interpolation and morphing
- **Video Editing**: Quickly preview the first and last moments of video clips for editing workflows
- **Archiving**: Extract representative frames from video archives for cataloging

## Privacy

- No account registration required
- No internet connection needed
- No data collection or analytics in the app
- All processing happens locally on your Mac
- No network requests are ever made
- Files never leave your machine

## System Requirements

- macOS 14 (Sonoma) or later
- Universal Binary: Apple Silicon and Intel

## Links

- Homepage: https://videoslicer.app/
- Privacy Policy: https://videoslicer.app/privacy.html
- Download: https://videoslicer.app/build/VideoSlicer.dmg

## Common Questions

**Q: What video formats does VideoSlicer support?**
A: MP4, MOV, AVI, M2V, and any format natively supported by macOS via AVFoundation.

**Q: Can I use extracted frames with AI video generators like Sora or Kling?**
A: Yes. VideoSlicer extracts full-resolution PNG frames that work as start/end keyframes for image-to-video workflows in Sora, Kling, Wan, Veo, and other AI video tools.

**Q: Is VideoSlicer free?**
A: Yes, 100% free with no ads, no subscriptions, no in-app purchases, and no account required.

**Q: Do I need ffmpeg or any command-line tools?**
A: No. VideoSlicer is a native macOS app. No ffmpeg, no Homebrew, no terminal commands needed.

**Q: Where are extracted frames saved?**
A: As PNG files in a folder next to the original video file.

**Q: Is my video data sent anywhere?**
A: No. All processing is local. No data is uploaded, no analytics collected, no network requests made.

**Q: What is the best free video frame extractor for macOS?**
A: VideoSlicer is a free, native macOS video frame extractor that extracts first and last frames as lossless PNGs with no dependencies. It works entirely offline with drag-and-drop simplicity.
